channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Police search for person of interest after multiple people shot near Kentucky highway
item.description: Multiple people were shot on a highway north of London, Ky., on Saturday, the Laurel County Sheriff’s Office said, forcing the closure to a stretch of I-75.
item.content:encoded:
Multiple people were shot on a highway north of London, Ky., on Saturday, the Laurel County Sheriff’s Office said, forcing the closure to a stretch of I-75.

(Image credit: Camden Mink)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: A Florida high school football player died after collapsing during a game
item.description: The fatal collapse of Chance Gainer, a senior at Port St. Joe High School, is the latest in a string of recent deaths of young football players. Seven school athletes died last month.
item.content:encoded:
The fatal collapse of Chance Gainer, a senior at Port St. Joe High School, is the latest in a string of recent deaths of young football players. Seven school athletes died last month.

(Image credit: Kolbie Jones)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Aryna Sabalenka beats Jessica Pegula to win her first US Open
item.description: Aryna Sabalenka of Belarus got past American Jessica Pegula to win her first U.S. Open women’s title and third career Grand Slam title.
item.content:encoded:
Aryna Sabalenka of Belarus got past American Jessica Pegula to win her first U.S. Open women’s title and third career Grand Slam title.

(Image credit: Frank Franklin II)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 一位高调批评中共的异议人士会设下骗局吗？
item.description: 一位广为人知的中国共产党批评者现在被指欺诈
item.link: https://www.npr.org/2024/09/07/g-s1-20881/中国共产党-荷兰-王靖渝-欺诈
item.guid: https://www.npr.org/2024/09/07/g-s1-20881/中国共产党-荷兰-王靖渝-欺诈
item.content:encoded:
一位广为人知的中国共产党批评者现在被指欺诈

(Image credit: Warun Siriprachai 为 NPR 拍摄)
item.dc:creator: Frank Langfitt

item.title: A salmonella outbreak linked to recalled eggs sickens people in 9 states
item.description: Eggs branded Milo's Poultry Farms and Tony's Fresh Market were recalled after they were linked to a salmonella outbreak that has hospitalized at least 24 people.
item.content:encoded:
Eggs branded Milo's Poultry Farms and Tony's Fresh Market were recalled after they were linked to a salmonella outbreak that has hospitalized at least 24 people.

(Image credit: U.S. Food and Drug Administration)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Dick Cheney says he will vote for Harris
item.description: Former Vice President Dick Cheney said his decision had to do with Trump's attempts to overturn the 2020 presidential election.
item.content:encoded:
Former Vice President Dick Cheney said his decision had to do with Trump's attempts to overturn the 2020 presidential election.

(Image credit: Money Sharma)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: 'I lied.' A teacher describes protecting her students during Apalachee HS shooting
item.description: In a post shared widely on social media, Jennifer Carter gave her account about what it took to keep her students safe at the Georgia school where four people died this week.
item.content:encoded: In a post shared widely on social media, Jennifer Carter gave her account about what it took to keep her students safe at the Georgia school where four people died this week.
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: 1.5 million Ram pickups recalled over software problem affecting stability control
item.description: Stellantis is recalling nearly 1.5 million Ram pickup trucks worldwide to fix a software problem that can disable the electronic stability control system.
item.content:encoded:
Stellantis is recalling nearly 1.5 million Ram pickup trucks worldwide to fix a software problem that can disable the electronic stability control system.

(Image credit: Gene J. Puskar)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: First case of bird flu not directly linked to sick animals is found in Missouri
item.description: So far, there have been 14 human cases of bird flu this year. All the patients — except the one from Missouri — had been linked to sick dairy cows or poultry.
item.content:encoded:
So far, there have been 14 human cases of bird flu this year. All the patients — except the one from Missouri — had been linked to sick dairy cows or poultry.

(Image credit: Jim Watson)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: What West Bank Palestinian youths are fighting for, in their own words
item.description: The Israeli military vows to stamp out Palestinian militants in the occupied West Bank. Palestinian fighters tell NPR they are willing to die to resist Israeli occupation.
item.content:encoded:
The Israeli military vows to stamp out Palestinian militants in the occupied West Bank. Palestinian fighters tell NPR they are willing to die to resist Israeli occupation.

(Image credit: Ronaldo Schemidt)
item.dc:creator: Hadeel Al-Shalchi
